date.center: Motion to Set Aside Order Denied June 11, 1953.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Kenton Circuit Court, Criminal, Common Law and Equity Division, Joseph P. Goodenough, J.
opinion.attorneys:
Lester Riedinger and Lawrence Reidinger, Jr., Newport, for movant.
J.D. Buckman, Jr., Atty. Gen., and Zeb A. Stewart, Asst. Atty. Gen., opposed.
opinion.opinion_text:
We are of the opinion that the Judge of the Campbell Circuit Court had no jurisdiction of the case. Therefore, Shields had no basis for the plea of former jeopardy when he was placed on trial in the Kenton Circuit Court. 15 Am.Jur., Criminal Law, ยง 361, page 41.
The judgment of the Kenton Circuit Court is affirmed because that court had jurisdiction of the case. There was ample evidence to support the finding of the jury.Page 521
